text: The number of people living at the property will be
info: Any alteration to a shared house that would, after the works, have more than 6 people living there (known as a  'Large House in Multiple Occupation') will require planning permission.
howMeasured: A shared house (known as a House in Multiple Occupation or HMO) is a house or flat in which 3 or more people are living who belong to different families/households, and share kitchen, bathroom or toilet facilities. You can read more on this definition [here](https://www.gov.uk/private-renting/houses-in-multiple-occupation)

policyRef: Town and Country Planning (Use Classes) Order 1987
howMeasured: A 'shared house' (known as a House in Multiple Occupation or HMO) is a house or flat in which 3 or more people are living who belong to different families/households, and share kitchen, bathroom or toilet facilities. This does not include a homeowner who is living with a lodger, or domestic staff living with a family. You can read more on this definition [here](https://www.gov.uk/private-renting/houses-in-multiple-occupation)

info: Any outbuilding within the curtilage of a listed building will require planning permission.

howMeasured: This does not include any conversion of the original loft into habitable rooms.

text: Are there any protected trees on the property?
